attributes.action: Government to fund parallel running of mass production for all Covid-19 trials.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies do not have the funds to start mass production of a new vaccine until completion of a successful trial (maybe three months). Hence three months is lost before a mass production run can be started. 

Government, however, does have the funds to get mass production runs started at the same time as each trial of a Covid-19 vaccine is started. 90% of the trials may be unsuccessful and the production runs then binned, but for a successful trial the production is ready three months earlier.
attributes.background: Government should fund parallel running for mass production with the start of every Covid-19 vaccine trial. 90% of the trials may fail and the corresponding mass production runs would then go in the bin, but three months might be gained for the production run that corresponds with a successful trial
